Entries.default: The pool of water before you swirls in a riot of colors. The occasional bubble floats to the surface and pops, releasing a puff of colorful smoke that smells by turns acrid and flowery.
You dip a small glass bottle into the bubbling pool and hold it up to the light to get a better look.
You dip your bare hands into the pool and drink what doesn't slip between your fingers.
A strange warmth suffuses your limbs. You suddenly feel like you could knock out a dragon with a single punch.
The liquid flares with heat on your tongue and burns your throat going down.
Your tongue freezes and your teeth chatter. The liquid sits in your stomach like a block of ice.
You sprout soft fur, a long tail, and a little pink nose.
Static electricity stands your hair on end. A painful current crackles down your spine.
A massive rack of antlers spring from your forehead. Your fingers melt together and become hooves.
Thick, coarse fur sprouts from your skin. Your jaw dislocates and elongates, turning into a long snout. You can smell everything - and discover that everything smells bad.
Your skin turns a bright pink. Coarse, wiry little hairs coat your back. Your nose widens and flattens. You are possessed of a sudden desire to find a mud pit to lounge in.
Your stomach heaves, and you immediately throw up.
A crackle of electricity runs down your spine. You suddenly feel like you could best a panther in a race through the jungle.
You're briefly blinded by a blight flash of light. You're suddenly certain you could calculate the movement of the stars without so much as an abacus to aid you.
The liquid inside slowly separates into several levels. You surmise that the layers must be of different densities, and thus must in fact be several distinct liquids.
The fumes blur your vision and make your head spin.
